intro: Actinella lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly actinella, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly covering of hairs on its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. Actinella lanuginosa produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color.
